prompt_engine.description:
üöÄ PROMPT ENGINE ‚Äî Metadata-driven execution surface tuned for LLM clients.

**Operators (always available):**
‚Ä¢ Chain `-->` composes steps while preserving `chain_id`
‚Ä¢ Framework `@` temporarily injects a methodology (e.g., `@ReACT`)
‚Ä¢ Gate `::` adds inline validation criteria

**Gate review answers:** When Stage 5 pauses for human validation, resume with `gate_verdict: "GATE_REVIEW: PASS|FAIL - reason"` plus the original `chain_id`.

**Guides-on-demand:** Type `>>guide <topic>` (or `prompt_engine({"command": ">>guide gate controls"})`) to surface usage patterns, temporary gate schemas, and full parameter catalogs without memorizing payloads.

Responses echo gate scope and requested quality gates so you can reason about validation at a glance.
prompt_engine.shortDescription: üî• Guide-aware execution of prompts, templates, and chains

parameters.command: Prompt or chain command. Supports symbolic operators (`-->`, `@`, `::`). Use JSON when arguments span multiple lines.
parameters.chain_id: Resume token returned in responses (e.g., `chain-demo#2`). Reuse with the same command to continue a chain.
parameters.user_response: Result for the previous step; required when advancing chains.
parameters.gate_verdict: Answer to a pending gate review in the format `GATE_REVIEW: PASS|FAIL - reason`. Use this field instead of stuffing the verdict into `user_response`.
parameters.execution_mode: Force how the pipeline executes when semantic detection guesses wrong: `prompt`, `template`, `chain`, or `auto`.
parameters.api_validation: Manual gate-review handshake (defaults off). Set true only when you plan to send `gate_verdict` so the chain pauses without forcing retries.

quality_gates.description: List of gate IDs to enforce. Combine with `>>guide gate controls` for the latest catalog.

temporary_gates.description: Full gate definitions (id, criteria, severity). If an ID matches an existing gate, it automatically reuses that gate instead of duplicating it.

parameters.force_restart: Create a new chain execution (increments chain ID). Use `command'.
parameters.options: Bag of execution-specific options forwarded to downstream processors.

frameworkAware.enabled: üöÄ PROMPT ENGINE [FRAMEWORK-ENABLED]: Responses include methodology-specific coaching plus guide entries filtered by the active framework.
frameworkAware.disabled: üöÄ PROMPT ENGINE [FRAMEWORK-DISABLED]: Executes without methodology overlays while still supporting metadata-driven `>>guide` output.

parametersEnabled.execution_mode: Framework-aware override hints are surfaced via the guide.

prompt_manager.description:
üß≠ PROMPT MANAGER ‚Äî Lifecycle + discovery hub with inline guidance.

‚Ä¢ `action:"guide" goal:"gate config"` ranks canonical verbs and calls out high-risk ones.
‚Ä¢ Legacy verbs (`create_prompt`, `create_template`) stay blocked unless `allow_legacy:true`; the guide suggests modern replacements automatically.
‚Ä¢ Responses embed lifecycle warnings, issue summaries, and telemetry-backed hints so an LLM can correct requests without doc hunting.
prompt_manager.shortDescription: Manage prompts with guide-backed lifecycle cues

parameters.action: Supported: create, update, delete, list, reload, analyze_type, migrate_type, analyze_gates, suggest_temporary_gates, guide.
parameters.allow_legacy: Set true to temporarily unlock deprecated verbs (not recommended).
parameters.goal: Optional goal text consumed by the guide action for targeting suggestions.
parameters.include_legacy: When true, guide output includes deprecated or high-risk verbs.
parameters.id: Prompt identifier required for lifecycle and analysis actions.
parameters.name: Friendly name for create/update paths.
parameters.description: Human-readable summary stored with the prompt.
parameters.user_message_template: Main prompt body (Nunjucks friendly). Required for create.
parameters.system_message: Optional system message injected at run time.
parameters.content: Full JSON payload for advanced create/update scenarios.
parameters.category: Label for organization and list filtering.
parameters.arguments: Structured argument definitions for prompts that expect typed inputs.
parameters.gate_configuration: Explicit gate configuration applied to the prompt.
parameters.search_query: Filter syntax for the list action.

frameworkAware.enabled: üß≠ PROMPT MANAGER [FRAMEWORK-ENABLED]: Guide messaging and validations reflect the active methodology.
frameworkAware.disabled: üß≠ PROMPT MANAGER [FRAMEWORK-DISABLED]: Standard lifecycle handling with metadata-backed guides.

system_control.description:
‚öôÔ∏è SYSTEM CONTROL ‚Äî Framework, gate, and diagnostics cockpit.

‚Ä¢ `>>help` routes here and renders the same metadata-driven guide as `system_control action:"guide"`.
‚Ä¢ Use `action:"framework"` for switch/list/enable/disable, `action:"gates"` for discovery, `action:"analytics"` for planned telemetry surfaces.
‚Ä¢ Responses reiterate the active methodology and gate state so downstream LLMs stay aware of context.
system_control.shortDescription: Manage frameworks, gates, analytics, and maintenance

parameters.action: Top-level command: status, framework, gates, analytics, config, maintenance, guide.
parameters.operation: Sub-command for the selected action (e.g., framework switch/list).
parameters.framework: Framework identifier when switching (CAGEERF, ReACT, 5W1H, SCAMPER).
parameters.include_metrics: Request detailed analytics in status responses.
parameters.show_details: Expand verbose payloads for list/status commands.

frameworkAware.enabled: ‚öôÔ∏è SYSTEM CONTROL [FRAMEWORK-ENABLED]: Guide + routing automatically reflect the active methodology catalog.
frameworkAware.disabled: ‚öôÔ∏è SYSTEM CONTROL [FRAMEWORK-DISABLED]: Outputs omit methodology guidance but keep gate/system summaries.
